generic_filter(func: Callable, info: str)[source]
class gamut.operator.PeakSearcher.GaussPeakSearcher(order: int, threshold: float, label: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: PeakSearcher

if even o, o = o/2, g(i) = c(i+o) * c(i-o) / c(i+o+2) / c(i-o-2) if odd o, o = (o-1)/2 g(i) = c(i+o+1) * c(i-o) / c(i+o+3) / c(i-o-2)

gamut.operator.Smoother module

class gamut.operator.Smoother.CentroidSmoother(order: int = 2, label: str = None)[source]

Bases: Operator

The most basic smoother.

Parameters:

order – smoothing order, also the half-width of smoothing window

Label:

label for the operator

class gamut.operator.Smoother.SavitzkySmoother(order: int = 2, hwidth: int = 2, label: str = None)[source]

Bases: Operator

The most widely used smoother, applied in commercial codes, such as GammaVision & Genie2000 Reference:

A. Savitzky and M. J. E. Golay, “Smoothing and Differentiation of Data by Simplified Least Squares Procedures.” Anal. Chem., vol. 36, no. 8, pp. 1627–1639, Jul. 1964. [Online]. Available: http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ac60214a047

Parameters:

  • order – order of fitted polynomial

  • hwidth – half width of smoothing window

  • label – label for the operator

class gamut.operator.Smoother.FourierSmoother(mode: Literal['low', 'high', 'gauss'] = 'low', threshold: float = 0.6, label: str = None)[source]

Bases: Operator

Smoother based on Fourier Transformation. Reference:

Parameters:

  • order – order of fitted polynomial

  • hwidth – half width of smoothing window

  • label – label for the operator
